revised_title: Investigating the Causes of Anomalous Behavior in Delicate Balances and Improving Weighing Accuracy
tldr: This study investigates the causes of irregularities in delicate balances and proposes methods to improve weighing accuracy. The authors find that temperature fluctuations and improper knife-edge alignment are the main causes of anomalous behavior. They recommend using an inner case to shield the balance beam from temperature variations and suggest a fatigue period for the balance to reach a normal state before taking measurements.
